definition: Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
variant of 波濤粼粼|波涛粼粼[bo1 tao1 lin2 lin2]

sentences.english: I couldn’t resist rolling down the window. As soon as I did, I heard waves crashing along the shoreline.
sentences.chinese: 我忍不住摇下车窗，立即听到了波涛冲刷海岸的声音。

sentences.english: Qishui waves rolling in, spray wet the car curtain .
sentences.chinese: 淇水波涛滚滚，水花打湿了车上的布幔。

sentences.english: A porcelain Guanyin seated on a lotus flower over breaking waves.
sentences.chinese: 一尊瓷观音端坐在莲花瓣上，莲花下是波涛纹。

sentences.english: East China Sea mighty waves surges forward, the wave of our reform rushes ahead.
sentences.chinese: 东海波涛汹涌澎湃，改革大浪一往直前。

sentences.english: There was a terrible grace in the move of the waves.
sentences.chinese: 起伏的波涛有一种令人敬畏的美。

sentences.english: My name is Suntao Tao literally means billows or large waves.
sentences.chinese: 我叫孙涛涛字面意思是波涛海浪。

sentences.english: Waves lap on the rocky shore a few steps away from the ground-floor unit.
sentences.chinese: 该单元位于一楼，距离波涛击石的海岸数步之遥。

sentences.english: But we continue to steer a steady course through choppy waters, " he added.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们继续稳定地通过波涛汹涌的水域”他补充道。

sentences.english: The jubilant throng is like the waves of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 欢腾的人群宛如大海的波涛。

sentences.english: The rough waves capsized the rowboat .
sentences.chinese: 汹涌的波涛掀翻了划艇。

sentences.english: The ship was rolling heavily to and fro on the rough seas.
sentences.chinese: 船在汹涌的波涛中晃来晃去很不平稳。

sentences.english: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up.
sentences.chinese: 求你不要让波涛淹没我，也不要让深水吞灭我。

sentences.english: The waves boiled around the ship.
Humorous is lives in the mighty waves life-saving jacket.
sentences.chinese: 幽默是生活波涛中的救生圈。
大海开始变得波涛起伏。

sentences.english: Outside, waves pound the white sand beach, a hot wind whips the water.
sentences.chinese: 外面，波涛拍打着白砂沙滩，热风鞭笞着海水。

definition: to beat against the shore (of waves)
spray/ocean spray/spindrift/fig. happenings from one's life/CL:朵[duo3]
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
